title: Chinese Consumers Want a Safe & Automated Smart Home
text:
Submitted by admin on 10/21/2015 @ 2:00 AM   Strategy Analytics 
BOSTON, Oct. 21, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- A new report from the Connected Home UX group at Strategy Analytics ( www.strategyanalytics.com ) exploring Chinese consumers' usage, motivations and expectations of smart home devices, has found that security concerns and the need to monitor children's activities and safety, were the main reasons for adopting smart security devices. 
http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnvar/20130207/NE56457LOGO-b 
Surveying current owners of smart home devices, Strategy Analytics found that security was a concern to Chinese consumers living in ground floor apartments, rental properties, and residential communities that had little or no public security facilities. For these consumers, features that can enable them to monitor/view suspicious behavior, send notifications in 'unusual' circumstances, provide a wider angle of surveillance, and capture evidence when needed, are key capabilities. For consumers wanting to use smart security devices to monitor their children's activities, the ability to recognize kids at home, automatically follow their motion, and identify potential dangers, are particularly attractive features for parents. 
Click here for the report: http://bit.ly/1LsSPcD 
Alvin Wu, report author and Senior Analyst commented, "Consumers also expect comprehensive security features that enable strict access to the camera to prevent unauthorized users. Furthermore, easy installation and set-up is essential. Though several participants in this study were technology enthusiasts, many complained about the complexity of setting their devices up." 
Diane O'Neill, Director, UXIP, added "Overall, smart home products need to be intelligent and importantly, able to actively learn and adapt to users' habits and preferences to bring convenience and safety. As an increasing number of home appliances and devices are becoming 'smart', an elderly-friendly user interface will be essential. Hence, a control hub that can understand natural voice commands is the future interface that will provide the most usable and useful smart home experience."
